page.title: 08OLD BUILDINGS OF BRENTWOOD
page.content: Brentwood was originally called Burntwood and goes back to{pre-} {medieval times.}The ruins of an old chapel dedicated to St.Thomas Becket from{1221}still stands on the High Street where there are many old buildings such as the public house 'The Good Intent' which is over{200 {years}old,a row of shops built around {1880,}a chartered surveyor's about {250-300 years}old, the Old House(now a cafe) built in the{early 18th century with rustic terrace dated{1889. Brentwood School was founded in{1558 and contains some of Brentwood's oldest buildings. A memorial to William Hunter who was burnt at the stake in{1555}was erected in{1861. Brentwood Station dates back to{1843 and is largely responsible for the growth of Brentwood.
